name: Bucuti & Tara Beach Resorts Aruba

reviews.title: Great Staff, Second Rate Resort Manager!!
reviews.text: This was our second visit to the Bucuti Resort. We stayed in April '07 with friends and recently in Sept. '07 by ourselves. The hotel personnel are congenial and always willing to assist in any manner. The problem with Bucuti is the management and specifically the Resort Manager. Unfortunately this individual does not subscribe to the motto "the customer is always right". My wife and I had been ordering the same drink in April and again upon our recent return. Same drink, same price..................until one time, this visit, when the pricing was different. I simply asked the bartender to check with our usual bartender. Instead the Resort Manager came over and proceeded to give us a lecture on the size of the drink and make us feel totally uncomfortable. She asked "how many shots did you order?" I said I didn't order by the shot. I said I had been ordering the same drink 20 times over. The Resort Manager even came back with a martini glass to show me the level a shot came to. Needless to say this episode has squashed any desire to return to Bucuti. In addition we cut out any additional spending at the resort.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A surprize last minute trip for my birthday. My husband & I read reviews on trip advisor and decided to stay at Bucuti. It was a great experience. The hotel is clean, the staff are friendly and very helpful. Big thanks to manager, Erik Derks for pulling off the birthday surprize with my husband.
reviews.title: A hidden gem, loved it!

reviews.text: The first 2 nights were spent in a regular suite, which was fine, the last night we were in the penthouse. Wow, what a gorgeous room. A full kitchen with GE stainless steel appliances, full size refrigerator and stove. Even a dining room table.

reviews.title: Great honeymoon - loved the Penthouse!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pirates Nest is simple, decent food, nothing elaborate.
reviews.title: Coming back!
Just What We Wanted!
reviews.text: We wanted to get away to a beautiful beach and lay in the sun and quiet for a week. Aruba & The BB did just that for us. The beach is idyllic and the weather was hot and sunny although it was windy at times.

reviews.title: Good Honeymoon Spot
reviews.text: Our first night was in one of the Tara Suites and they look very chic and comfortable. We then moved to the Garden Rooms (ground floor opening onto the lawn). The room was 'tired' but a refurb is bringing them up to Tara standards in slow time. The staff have been great and could not have done more for us, except........

reviews.title: Fantastic honeymoon spot!
reviews.text: BB does not encourage children, which is one of the primary reasons we chose to stay - no kids. Guess what we had next door - it walked and it wailed and cried at 5 in the morning. It seemed very selfish to us that people should bring children to a hotel that outwardly does not encourage kids seeing as most who come to BB do so to A) get married, B) come on their honeymoon or C) want to get away from kids and everyday noise! Come on Bucuti - make it "no kids". We asked to be moved but the request fell on deaf ears. Disappointing! For those of you who want to bring your kids to Aruba, all of the high-rise hotels have great pools, kids-clubs and baby-sitting services.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2005
reviews.text: Food wise.....
reviews.title: A bit overrated....
Enjoyed staying at the Bucuti
reviews.text: We bought into the 'dine-around' plan - $44 pp per day. The price included a ~$13 breakfast buffet every day and dinner could be had at a number of different island restaurants. Some deals included 3-courses plus coffee whilst others gave a $30 credit. Out of 8 meals we took 4 as the $30 credit. At each we had additional drinks (bottles of wine, etc). Some of the deals limited the starters to the basics with an additional $2-5 paid for the good stuff. In all, we found the dining expensive for the quality we wanted. Theres plenty of pizza and fast food if you're counting the pennies.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2005
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Bucuti again last week after a great stay there 2 years ago. We stayed in the Tara Beach Suites, which were under construction the last time we were there. The Suites are quite spacious and well-appointed, with a sink, microwave, minibar that has space for extras, a sitting area, and a bedroom with sliding doors that open to the sitting area. There is also a balcony that looks out over the beach and ocean. The bathroom is very good and about what you'd expect as far as size is concerned. The beach is the best in Aruba, and is perfect for those who want a beach that is spread out and feels uncrowded. The Bucuti is meant for couples who want a quiet, romantic retreat. The high rise hotels are meant for those who bring their children or want a party atmosphere. I will unfortunately have to agree with those who give the Pirate's Nest Restaurant at the Bucuti a less than glowing review. Although the restaurant is well located on the beach with a sunset view, the Spaghetti Frutti di Mare we each ordered was very poor. The menu suggested that it would contain shrimp, scallops, and calamari. What we received was spaghetti with salad bar tiny shrimp that you can buy in a can, a few scallops, and filler white fish. No calamari to be found. There are many great restaurants a short cab ride away, so you don't even need to eat there. The South American steakhouses like El Gaucho are excellent, as are the Italian restuarants like Hostaria da Vittorio. Pizza Bob's is just in front of the hotel and is a good place for lunch or an informal dinner. Otherwise, the Bucuti is a great place to stay for a relaxing beach vacation. The staff are friendly and helpful, as are the locals in Aruba. We would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Hard to Beat the Bucuti
Bucui is paradise
reviews.text: We just returned from our Honeymoon and had an absolute BLAST! We also experienced the noise others did in the main Bucui wing of the hotel, but the staff was very accomodating. Pamela (one of the managers) offered us the company car for the day (to explore the island) and after a few days, they also moved us away from the construction to one of the newly renovated rooms, which are MUCH nicer!

This was a great start to our honeymoon. We stayed in the Tara Beach Suites which we loved. The bed was very comfortable and the room very clean. We were on the third floor and had a great view of the beach.
reviews.title: Perfect Honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As others have said the beach is amazing and you can get seats at any time of the day. I loved the pool – it is small but it’s always empty and again very clean. Take note that you need your room key to go everywhere!
reviews.title: Honeymoon October 15, 2007

likes.liked: — It was quiet and not over crowded.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007
reviews.text: I didn’t like the on site restaurant (Pirate’s Restaurant). I thought it was very expensive for what you got. Having said that it’s perfect for lunch – raise your red flag and get some beers and a hot dog (or salad) brought down to you on the beach – that is the life!! We got the honeymoon package from Bucuti and had our romantic dinner on the beach – it was nice but there are 4 little huts in a row right in front of the restaurant and there are 2 sittings each night. Not really how I imagined it but still it was worthwhile. The ‘Sweetheart Sunset Sail’ was ok. It was nice to see the island from a boat but that’s about it… There was an open bar with cheap champagne and watered down spirits. It’s probably just as well – an open bar with irish people would be dangerous!
reviews.title: Total relaxation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went horse riding which was good – nice to see the other side of the island. Also after reading the reviews here we went to Madame Janettes and the Flying Fishbone for dinner. Both were well worth a visit; particularly the Flying Fishbone. It was a completely unique experience – tables in the sand with a view of the sunset, truly beautiful. And the food was delicious too. It is a good bit away from Bucuti but I think it’s worth it. We got a taxi there and back which was $25 each way. A lot of people were renting cars but we found it more relaxing being able to have a few drinks and not having to worry about driving on the wrong side of the road!
reviews.title: Tips Galore

likes.liked: — Beautiful modern rooms and really nice beach
likes.disliked: — wish that the breakfast was until 12 - I wanted to sleep in!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate in the Manchebo French Steakhouse which was nice and right beside Bucuti, Pizza Bob’s was perfect for lunch. Otherwise we went into Oranjested for dinner – there are lots of restaurants to choose from here. Most evenings after dinner we went down to the beach with some beers. The Sand Bar is not good in my opinion – the seats are all very close together and you kind of have to talk to other couples which can get awkward!
reviews.title: Bucuti is the Best

likes.liked: — Low key atmosphere and stylish room

reviews.title: Great honeymoon in Aruba and at Bucuti
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from our 8-day honeymoon to Aruba. We stayed at the Bucuti Beach Resort and Spa in the new Tara Suites and really enjoyed our stay. The rooms are clean and spacious. Refrigerator decent size to store some snacks in. Maid service very good. Concierge very helpful with everything. The staff is very attentive and very friendly, from bell hops to the towel person, from security to the bartenders. Always a smile and warm greeting. Eagle Beach is absolutely amazing. Plenty of huts and palm trees around. Not as crowded and noisy as the high-rise area. Many less children too. The pool at Bucuti is average at best. We looked at it the first day and never looked at it again...the beach is just too amazing to not be on everyday. The hotel's restaurant, the Pirate's Nest, is average too. Breakfast was good. Lunch at the bar area was okay...very slow service for lunch...over an hour for a grilled cheese and BLT sandwich and the cheese wasn't even melted and bread not toasted. Tried lunch again a couple days later and was exactly the same slow service. Dinner wasn't bad on our first night there...we also did the romantic dinner on the beach and the 5-course meal was actually very tasty and our server was very attentive!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2005
reviews.text: We did a few activities such as a couples massage (very good), played golf at the new Divi Links course (also very good), and went on a sunset sail with Redsail Adventures (a lot of fun). We had dinner at El Gaucho, Texas de Brazil, and Acqua Grill and loved them all! The food and service at these places was outstanding. My favorite was Acqua Grill while my husband loved Texas de Brazil!!
reviews.title: Bucuti is the Best!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2005
reviews.text: Overall, we really enjoyed Aruba and look forward to returning in the future!
reviews.title: Beautiful, Peaceful, Romantic
Fantastic Hotel & Beach
reviews.text: My wife and I celebrated our 25th wedding anniversary at Bucuti from July 16 through July 23, 2005. We had a fantastic time on our first trip to the Caribbean and we highly recommend this hotel to adult clientele.

reviews.title: Sunsets made just for us
reviews.text: We had considered one of the "high rise" resorts, but after visiting some of them, we are really glad we chose Bucuti instead. The Tara Suites were superb, the resort setting is great, the staff were always courteous and helpful, and the facilities for "just plain relaxing" on the beach were perfect.

reviews.title: Fabulous
reviews.text: Beautiful Hotel, gorgeous beach.. take me back!! The food was great. The service was wonderful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife & I just got back from our 3rd stay @ the Bucuti in the past 5 years. It was great to see that this small, beautiful hotel is able to maintain a level of service and facilities that still rivals many 5 star hotels - while adding that personal touch that a makes you feel right at home. If you are looking for a place for an adult oriented get away (it really isn't geared towards kids) the Bucuti is still a great find & deserving of all the good reviews.

reviews.title: Bucuti is about the service, not the drama

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at the Bucuti twice now, January of 2005 and 2007 and plan on going back January 2008, if that gives you any idea how much we love this place. This hotel would be considered smaller in comparison to the other high rises on the island but that is part of the beauty. You do NOT have 500 rooms with 500+ guest all packed onto the beach like sardines. It all seems very private and there is always room on the beach with palapas (umbrellas) and lounge chairs for the guests. The beach is huge meaning deep from waters edge inland, not this strip of sand right along the water. The rooms are fantastic, we have always stayed in the Tara Beach Suites which include a sink, refridgerator, dishes and silverware so if you wish to go to the grocery store and get some food you can. Having lunch on the beach is great but can get pricey if you do it every day, so making sandwiches can save a few bucks as well as getting sodas and even making some mixed drinks yourself. If you do not stay at the Suites or in a "ocean view" room... as one other review pointed out there was no view, well they did not pay for a room with a view so you can't really compain about it. Although it may not be "oceanview" no view would be bad at this resort. If you are thinking about renting a car for the duration of your trip I would highly recommed AGAINST it. There really is no need, spend the money on the upgraded room. Take the time to understand and use the bus system! It is very cheap and easy, $2 round trip per person, there is a main road that runs from town all the way the way down which ends at the highrises. So the Bucuti is in the middle somewhere. Take advantage of this you can do all your eating and shopping this way at a VERY low cost. If you want to explore rent a car for a day which the Bucuti will help set up for you. We have not done much exploring so I can not comment on what to see. The staff is awsome, sooo helpful. We liked some art they had hanging and they found the artist and the name and addess and phone number on where it could be purchased... which was not liked to them at all, now thats service. They are always helpful and genuinly interested in how you are and if you need anything. The only downfall to this place is the Pirates Nest Restuarant (for dinner) it is fine for a burger etc at lunch, so just make other choices for dinner, unless you want the dinner on the beach. We have not done it, but it does look very romantic. If you are about kicking back and relaxing on the beach this is the perfect place to go. Beautiful beach, beautiful rooms, great staff! You can't go wrong!!!!
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.liked: — The Beach, the rooms and best of all No Children!!!

reviews.title: The very best
reviews.text: Wow! My wife and I stayed at the Bucuti Beach Resort from July 28th through Aug. 5. We wanted to get married on a beautiful beach somewhere in the caribean and looked at several loactions. We picked a hotel in Cancun and began the process of booking the trip and wedding through the hotel. It was an awful experence, we could never get anybody to return our call or get the wedding cordinator to give us a date that was available. We did not feel comfortable about getting married at a hotel that could not return our calls or make us feel like a priority. This is our wedding we're talking about, so we decided to switch our location and talk to Bucuti. We were really impressed by how great the staff was. They were very helpful and responded very quickly. The wedding cordinator was amazing. She made our wedding a top priority, that made us feel real good about picking Bucuti.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed in the Tara suites and loved everything about it. Check in was very easy and very quick. The room was just perfect. I read a lot of reviews about the room and was wondering about some of the things that I had read. The dehumidifer was not a problem for us, I like a little noise when I sleep so it was great for me. The water temperture in the shower was plenty hot, and the house keeping was perfect. I know at times the ball can be dropped and service can suffer but I beleive that the for the most part they care and will do everything they can to help.
reviews.title: Return visit, dissapointed?

likes.liked: — so close to the beach. Feeling of peace.
likes.disliked: — The curtain opened the opposite end to the door.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We rented a car while in Aruba, that is a must if you decide to stay a week or more. We ate twice at the pirates nest, the rest of the time we ate out. There are a lot of great places to eat around Aruba so it is great to have your own car so that you can tour the island and try all the great restaurants. The Bucuti has plans to rebuild the Pirates nest next year. Right now the only down side to the whole resort is the restraunt. It does not fit in to the theme that the owners are trying to create. The new restrauant will be two story and will be a great center piece to a wonderful resort.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did our civil cermony in Aruba and also had our beach wedding wedding at Bucuti. The wedding cordanitor took care of everything for us. I wish the wedding on the beach would have been the only one that we had to do but to make it legal we had to do the civil cermony downtown. They took care of the transportation downtown for us and had everthing perfect for us for the beach wedding. I have had the big church wedding before and this time I wanted a small wedding on the beach with just my wife and I and I will tell you that is the way to do it. There was nobody there except my wife and I, so we didn't have to worry about our guest and making sure everybody was happy or taken care of, all we had to worry about was ourselves and making it a perfect day. Bucuti made it so easy for us, we will be back as many times as we can. Bucuti will always be a special place for us.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay -- returning ASAP!

likes.disliked: — Mattress could have been a touch more comfy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our return trip to the Bucuti. We were there on our honeymoon 5 1/2 years ago. The Bucuti has gotten more expensive, but we were once again very happy staying here. It has by far the best beach of any hotel and is definitely the most relaxing. The other hotels are crowded and have kids running around everywhere.
reviews.title: Always Happy at the Bucuti

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were disappointed by the female beach attendant and one of the concierges was no help, but other than that, everything at the hotel is perfect. This is the best hotel on the best Caribbean island. We will be back.
reviews.title: Great time in Aruba.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was me and my wife's first trip to Aruba and we had a great time. The hotel staff was very intentive and very friendly. Next year we are planing to extend our trip, one week was just not enough. The hotel was very clean and you could tell the staff had a lot of pride working there.
reviews.title: Quiet Adults Only Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We selected Bucuti primarily because it is an adult only resort. Our kids are grown so I don't want to listen to unattended kids on my vacation.
reviews.title: Honeymoon in Aruba

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bucuti is quiet and very relaxing. There are always plenty of beach chairs on the beach and full size beds by the pool. We stayed in the Tara Suites and the room was very nice and well maintained. Maid service was a bit spotty but they would come immediately if you called. Breakfast is included and the food was fine. Dinner for two on the beach was very nice and uniquely set in a private hut on the beach. Overall service and friendliness of the staff was not at the level I would expect at a resort in the price range. The bar service was very slow and not very friendly. There is a great bar, Matthews, about a 5 minute walk down the beach. Ask for Jorge the bartender.
reviews.title: $15.00 for a mixed drink the size of a Dixie Cup...
Perfect Honeymoon Location
reviews.text: We stayed at the Bucuti in January for both our wedding and honeymoon. First, I would like to say that Nashette did a wonderful job at making our day absolutely perfect. I had a great experience from the time I booked the wedding until the day we left. I have always wanted to get married on the beach and we couldn't have chosen a more beautiful place to do so. The flowers were lovely and everything was just as I had imagined it would be. Nashette was very organized and not at any point did I feel stressed out. She handled every detail down to my hair and makeup (which by the way turned out flawless)! I would also like to add that the photographer (Kenny with Timeless Pixx) was so much fun to work with and his pictures turned out amazing! I highly recommend using him if you decide to get professional pictures while in Aruba.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach by far was the best part of our vacation. We are beach people and this tops all that we have been to. The weather was nice everyday, a little windy on one of the days, but otherwise perfect. We went to the market and bought beer to take the the beach along with liquor for our room. I would highly recommend doing so unless you are wanting frozen drinks. The service is good at the bar, it was just less expensive and easier if you are a beer drinker. We did however have drinks & snacks during happy hour at the bar.
reviews.title: Fantastic place - can't wait to return to Bucuti!
Wish We Were Still There
reviews.text: We stayed in the Tara Suites and our room was nice with a gorgeous view of the beach/ocean. The housekeeping staff did a good job at straightening up everyday and we found our room to be very clean compared to other places we have stayed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did not rent a car during our stay since we figured we would be having drinks and probably didn't need to be driving around on a strange island! We had no problems at all getting a taxi, although they are quite pricey. We ended up taking the bus into town and out to eat several times. It was an adventure to say the least! That's definitely the way to go if you don't want to spend $30 for a cab each way.
reviews.title: Eagle Beach, simply the best strip of beach in aruba
ENJOYED BUCUTI
reviews.text: We ate at several different restaurants our favorite was The Old Man and the Sea. It is a $30 cab ride - we were able to take a minvan bus there - cab back. The food was wonderful and the atmosphere was what made this restaurant our favorite. It is very romantic, candlelit and right on the beach. If I could only recommend one place to eat it would be here. The Flying Fishbone (which is next door) would be our 2nd. From what I understand they are run by the same owners.

reviews.title: Best Vacation Ever
reviews.text: We spent the week of October 13, 2007 until October 20, 2007 at the Bucuti. We were there on our honeymoon and stayed in the Tara Suites. From the time we checked in, we felt like we were part of the family. Deborah, the general manager, met us and knew our names and which room we were staying in. We stayed on the first floor, room 302, facing the beach. as you stepped out, walked across a small patch of grass, you were on the beach.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: October is a strange month in Aruba. The weather is nearing the tail end of the so called rainy season. We had rain on saturday, followed by very humid weather for the next three days. They told us that if there is a storm out to sea, it sucks the wind away from the Island, and causes a humid condition.
reviews.title: Nearly perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was wonderful, had a honeymoon dinner, (5 courses) on the beach. We went to Champions sports bar to watch the Patriots on sunday, Tried Pizza Bob's as recommended, and the French Steakhouse. Also tried Smokey Joe's, across from the Holiday Inn, and La Dolce Vita for italian food. All the restaurants were wonderful.
reviews.title: Bucuti made our honeymoon PERFECT

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We took a Sunset Sail as part of the honeymoon package from Bucuti, and enjoyed that as well as fishing.(caught only one barracuda, not a wonderful fishing week in Aruba)
reviews.title: Wonderful Bucuti!
Everything was fantastic!!!!!
reviews.text: There was always a palapa to sit under even at 12:00 p.m.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Bucuti wing for a week just before christmas. It was our honeymoon, and we have absolutely nothing but good to say about the hotel. The best thing was the location at the low rise area on the wide and quiet part of the eagle beach. No crowds at all, you could always find an umbrella and feel like there was only couple of people at the beach at the same time. We also saw the high rise area, and were very happy about our choice to stay at the Bucuti. Staff was very friendly, and the grounds beautyful. Even our room, wich was superior room on the second floor of the bucuti wing was very nice, eventhough we heard that the suites are even better. But for us and for our budget the room was more than adequate. We could still enjoy the sun and the gorgeous beach!!
reviews.title: Great for honeymooners

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only downside about the hotel and its location was that most of the dining options required a taxi ride (about 8-10 dollars to oranjestad) or catching a bus that didn't run according to any schedules. We had one dinner at the pirate's nest, which we thought was overprized and not very tasty, and one lunch which was ok. Otherwise we grabbed lunch from subway nearby and were lucky to catch busses to downtown for dining. Our favourite restaurants were Pinchos bar & grill - a very romantic restaurant located on a pier just outside the center of Oranjestadt - and an italian place in the high rise area. Iguana Joe's was also a very good choice if you're looking for reasonable price and good quality. We also had sushi at the Renaissance/Seaport mall, which was very good.
reviews.title: Amazing! "hopi dushi"!
The Perfect Escape
reviews.text: A week in Aruba was an optimal stay for us. I think we both, and especially my husband, would have gotten bored after that, since we're not that into water sports or diving or only sunbathing for two weeks, and there's really nothing else to do on the island. We rented a Jeep for one day and it was a lot of fun, but you could drive around the island on one day since it's so small. If you do rent a car, get a 4W-Jeep. That way you can get to every place on the island and don't have to drive with the crowds and tourist busses through the main roads. For example to visit the Natural Pool you definately need a 4W-Jeep, since there's no road to it. There's also literally no signs or street names, but it's hard to get lost on an small island like Aruba.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All and all, I can truly recommend this place especially for those who are looking for a beautiful beach, romantic getaway or spendig their honeymoon here. I can't really say what the nightlife is like at Aruba, since we only enjoyed the happy hour at our hotels Sandbar (recommended)! For us the vacation was all about relaxing and enjoying each others company.
reviews.title: The Best in Aruba

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Honeymooners from Finland
reviews.title: Great Hotel on Lovely Beach!!
THE BEST.....
reviews.text: My wife and I returned fromthe resort from a 8 night stay in the Tara suites and we cannot wait to return . the rooms are clean and very modern. The view of Eagle Beach is fantastic from the suites. The conciere desk is fantastic , Sietske (front desk in the Tara) is wonderful, and very friendly. The onle downer about the hotel is the Pirates nest restruant. The lunch is good ( theybring it to you right on the beach) but the Breakfast is way over priced and not that tasty. From all of the bad reviews , we didnt even eat dinner there. Pizza Bobs across the street is GREAT. Try the pizza accompianed be a mug of Balashi or a Aruba ariba ( the national rum punch)

reviews.title: Paradise at Bucuti!
reviews.text: The staff at the bar at the beach is very friendly and the happy hours are a great deal (4-6pm and 9-10 pm) You can enjoy drinks on the beach for under 5.00 / drink . The bartenders are very friendly. They have a steel drum player named Lee Connors playing almost every night which is a great asset to the atmosphere.

reviews.title: Perfect honeymoon!
reviews.text: The Bucuti is a top notch resort to relax and enjoy each others company, This resort is not for haevy partying or kids, it is geared for coupled adults to enjoy the beautiful island and crystal clear waters

reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.text: We had a great honeymoon and we WILL return!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2005
reviews.text: My husband and I spent all last week on our honeymoon at the Tara Suites in Aruba and had an amazing time! The suite is beautiful! It's almost like an apartment since it had a family room, bathroom, kitchenette, and bedroom. Plus a balcony with a great view of the ocean. It is quiet and peaceful and makes you just feel like relaxing all the time. The concierge is extremely helpful in booking whatever you want to do. You just go down to the desk and tell them what activity/restaurant you want and they'll make the reservations for you. You can also tell them you want to do a certain type of activity and they'll help you pick out the best tour for you. I wouldn't worry about planning everything in advance. Most of the time, we made our reservations the day before and were able to do everything we wanted to. Also, our room was always kept clean and they turned down our bed everynight for us.

aka: Bucuti & Tara Beach Resorts Aruba Hotel
description: This adults-only, romantic resort is award-winning and owner-operated. Recognitions include Top 3 Beach Destinations in the World, Conde Nast Gold List, Top 10 Romantic Retreats in the Caribbean, Green Globe High Achievement Award, and TripAdvisor's 2013 Certificate of Excellence. Bucuti & Tara Beach Resorts is eco-friendly and offers a tranquil boutique experience with friendly service.
